title: Ticket #4605: Current test config scripted into existance
description:
We currently tweak the generic sample and write lots into the .local config file. With all the config changes and for testing we want to remove most of the config code and base our new personals on the config generated by install_condor.

This round of changes switches linux and windows testing to using whatever condor_config exists at the time they start. Condor_confg_val -writeconfig is used to create the template main config file condor_tests/derived_condor_config. This then becomes the basis for anyy additional personal condors. A select number of local config entries are generated along with any needs for the current personal condor being generated.

In the test glue we run condor_install and use the condor_config thus created as our basis. In windows we take the condor_config.generic after we unpack the MSI and adjust RELEASE_DIR, LOCAL_DIR and LOCAL_CONFIG_FILE as our staring place.
